content:
• Monday, February 26, 2018
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy to pay dividends on convertible preferred stock in cash

    • Sanchez Energy (NYSE:SN) +3.4% after-hours after announcing it will pay dividends on series A and B convertible perpetual preferred shares in cash rather than in common stock.
    • SN will pay a quarterly dividend of nearly $0.61/share on the 4.875% series A convertible shares and more than $0.81/share on the 6.5% series B shares.
    • SN finished +4% in today's trade following its Q4 earnings report.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 PM | 17 Comments
  • DISCA

    Discovery sells majority of education unit to private-equity firm for $120M

    • Discovery Communications (NASDAQ:DISCA) is selling majority ownership of Discovery Education to private-equity firm Francisco Partners.
    • The all-cash deal comes at $120M. Discovery will retain a minority stake and license the Discovery Education brand to the business.
    • After the closing, expected in the first half of the year, Discovery Education CEO Bill Goodwyn and his team will operate the unit as a stand-alone business.
    • Discovery shares were a top gainer among big media stocks today, with DISCA rising to close up 4.8%; shares are still on the move after hours, up 2.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 PM
  • CRC

    California Resources -3% as production, costs disappoint

    • California Resources (NYSEMKT:CRC) -3% after-hours despite posting a much smaller than expected Q4 loss, as revenues come in flat Y/Y at $455M, coming in well short of expectations.
    • CRC says production fell 6.6% Y/Y to 126K boe/day for Q4, and slid 7.8% Y/Y to 140K boe/day for FY 2017, mostly because of reduced volumes of natural gas from the San Joaquin Basin; the company forecasts Q1 production of 120K-125K boe/day at production costs of $19.25-$20.75/boe.
    • Q4 production costs were $19.64/boe, compared to $17.50/boe in the prior-year quarter, driven by an increase in energy costs; for FY 2017, production costs were $18.64/boe vs. $15.61/ble in 2016.
    • CRC expects FY 2018 capex of $425M-$450M vs. $371M in 2017.
    • Year-end proved reserves of 618M boe, up from 568M boe at year-end 2016, organically replacing 119% of reserves from the capital program, excluding price revisions.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:42 PM | 11 Comments
  • THC

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (2/26/2018)

    • Top gainers: THC +6.6%. PANW +5.3%. INSG +3.6%. TTS +2.9%. ZN +2.1%.
    • Top losers: AKRX -39.9%. NTRI -27.1%. VERI -14.9%. FIT -10.8%. CRZO -6.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • WDR

    Waddell & Reed cut to junk by Moody’s - Bloomberg

    • Moody's cut the asset manager's outlook from stable to negative.
    • The rating agency says "that sustained net outflows and inconsistent investment performance have materially weakened Waddell & Reed’s (NYSE:WDR) competitive position within the industry."
    • Previously: Waddell & Reed Financial reports 4% M/M higher AUM after months of steady AUM (Feb. 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 5 Comments
  • IDTI

    Piper Jaffray initiates Integrated Device, MACOM, and Qorvo

    • Piper Jaffray initiates Integrated Device Technology (NASDAQ:IDTI) coverage with an Overweight rating and a $33 price target, a nearly 8% upside to today’s close. 
    • The firm initiates MACOM (NASDAQ:MTSI) with a Neutral rating and a $22 price target, which is 14 cents below today’s close. 
    • Qorvo (NASDAQ:QRVO) was initiated with an Overweight rating.
    • Source: Briefing.com. 
    • Qorvo shares are up 0.1% aftermarket.        
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 1 Comment
  • AKRX

    Akron down 34% after hours on Fresenius inquiry into data integrity

    • Akorn (NASDAQ:AKRX) slumps 34% after hours on a disclosure by acquirer Fresenius Kabi that it is investigating alleged breaches of FDA data integrity by Akorn related to product development. It adds that the outcome of the inquiry may have an effect on the merger.
    • Previously: Analysts say Akron/Fresenius deal fairly priced (April 25, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 15 Comments
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil -6% ahead of 'double-digit increase' in 2018 oilfield service costs

    • Carrizo Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:CRZO) -6% after-hours despite posting modestly better than expected Q4 earnings and revenues.
    • CRZO says Q4 production of 62,417 boe/day rose 39% Y/Y and ended above the high-end of its guidance range, with crude oil production of 40.2K bbl/day coming in 40% above the year-ago quarter.
    • CRZO forecasts FY 2018 production of 58.5K-60.1K boe/day, or ~10% annual growth at the midpoint of the range, while expecting capital spending of $750M-$800M, assuming a "double-digit increase" in oilfield service costs.
    • Year-end 2017 proved reserves were 261.7M boe, up 31% Y/Y; crude oil reserve rose 30% Y/Y to 167.4M barrels, the company's highest-ever level of crude oil reserves.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM | 62 Comments
  • VLRX

    Valeritas EPS of -$3.10

    • Valeritas (NASDAQ:VLRX): Q4 EPS of -$3.10 may not be comparable to consensus of -$1.59.
    • Revenue of $5.8M (+20.8% Y/Y) beats by $0.2M.
    • Shares +4.45%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • THC

    Tenet Q4 top line up 2%; non-GAAP earnings up 509%; cash flow up 268%; shares up 4% after hours

    • Tenet Healthcare (NYSE:THC): Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 5,303 (+1.7%).
    • Net loss: (229) (-189.9%); loss/share: (2.27) (-187.3%); non-GAAP EPS: 1.40 (+508.7%); non-GAAP EBITDA: 840 (+29.2%); cash flow ops:  491 (+267.6%).
    • 2018 guidance: Revenues: $17.9B - 18.3B; non-GAAP EBITDA; $2.5B - 2.6B; operating income: $95M - 105M; EPS: $0.92 - 1.02; non-GAAP EPS: $0.73 - 1.07.
    • Shares are up 4% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • PANW

    Palo Alto Networks +5.7% on Q2 beats, upside guidance; billings +20%

    • Palo Alto Networks (NYSE:PANW) pushes up 5.7% aftermarket following Q2 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 28.3% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • Upside Q3 guidance: Revenue, $538 to $548M (consensus: $533.12M); Product revenue, $193M to $196M (+18% to 19% Y/Y); billings, $665M to $680M (+22% to 25%); EPS, $0.94 to $0.96 (consensus: $0.81).
    • Upside FY18 guidance: Revenue, $2.19B to $2.22B (consensus: $2.17B); Product revenue, $810M to $820M (+14% to 16%); billings, $2.715 to $2.77B (+18% to 21%); EPS, $3.84 to $3.91 (consensus: $3.40). 
    • Billings and revenue breakdown: Billings totaled $674.6M, up 20% on the year. Deferred revenue grew 33% to $2B. 
    • Key metrics: Cash flow form operations, $243.7M; FCF, $218.1M; total operating expenses, $414.9M; cash and equivalents, $2.4B. 
    • Tax reform impact: Company changed non-GAAP effective tax rate rom 31% to 22%, which resulted in a Q2 EPS benefit of $0.11.  
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern Time with a webcast available here. 
    • Press release        
    • Previously: Palo Alto Networks beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • VERI

    Veritone drops after deeper loss than expected

    • Veritone (NASDAQ:VERI) has slipped 11.6% after hours following Q4 earnings after posting a deeper loss than expected and missing on revenues despite heavy Y/Y gains.
    • Net loss widened to $12.8M from $9.9M; EBITDA was -$10.2M vs. a prior-year -$7.2M (and missing an expected -$7.8M).
    • Revenue breakout: Media agency revenues, $3.02M (up 36.9%); AI platform revenues, $477,000 (up 61.1%).
    • For Q1 on its aiWARE platform, it expects to add eight customers, 110 accounts, and 20 third-party cognitive engines (and one cognitive category), and is guiding to processing 1.9M total hours of video/audio content.
    • Conference call to come at 4:30 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • NTRI

    Nutrisystem craters after weak revenue guidance

    • The wheels have fallen off Nutrisystem (NASDAQ:NTRI) after the company's guidance for  fell short of expectations for the critical Q1 period and the full year.
    • The company sees revenue of $204-209M for Q1 vs. $241M consensus estimate .For the full year, Nutrisyustem anticipates revenue of $685-705M vs. $790M consensus.
    • Shares of Nutrisystem are down 21% in AH trading after shedding about 4% during the regular session before the earnings report hit.
    • Previously: Nutrisystem beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM | 13 Comments
  • FIT

    Fitbit -11% after Q4 miss, downbeat revenue and profit guidance

    • Fitbit (NYSE:FIT) has slid in after-hours trade, down 11%, after Q4 earnings missed on top and bottom lines and the company issued dim guidance for the current quarter and year head.
    • Double-digit revenue declines in the U.S. swamped solid gains in the rest of the world and triggered a miss of Street expectations.
    • Meanwhile, net losses narrowed heavily but the company missed analyst expectations for a break-even quarter, losing $45.5M.
    • Fitbit sold 5.4M wearables in the quarter; average selling price rose 20%, to $102/device thanks to adding in smartwatch Fitbit Ionic.
    • New devices (Fitbit Ionic, Alta HR, Fitbit Aria 2 and Fitbit Flyer) made up 36% of revenue.
    • Revenue by geography: U.S., $330.2M (down 13.4%); Americas ex-U.S., $46.7M (up 39.7%); EMEA, $155.1M (up 15.7%); APAC, $38.8M (up 55.9%).
    • For Q1, the company sees "limited revenue from new product introduction," and guides to revenue of $240M-$255M -- a 15-20% drop, and well below consensus for $340.3M. It also sees EPS of -$0.21 to -$0.18, below expected -$0.09. Free cash flow should decline less than revenues and end up about -$25M.
    • For the full year, it's forecasting revenue of $1.5B (below consensus for $1.73B) and a negative impact on gross margins from device mix shift and fixed cost deleveraging.
    • Conference call to come at 5 p.m. ET.
    • Press release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 27 Comments
  • THC

    Tenet Healthcare beats by $0.15, beats on revenue

    • Tenet Healthcare (NYSE:THC): Q4 EPS of $1.40 beats by $0.15.
    • Revenue of $4.98B (+2.5% Y/Y) beats by $110M.
    • Shares +3.3%.

  • CLVS

    Clovis Oncology Q4 Rubraca sales: $17M; shares down 1% after hours

    • Clovis Oncology (NASDAQ:CLVS) Q4 results ($M): Product sales: 17.0 (+999%) (Rubraca).
    • Net loss: (51.9) (+26.6%);non-GAAP net loss: (63.4) (+10.3%); loss/share: (1.04) (+43.2%); non-GAAP loss/share: (1.27) (+30.6%); cash flow ops (65.6) (-19.9%).
    • Amount of free Rubraca available under patient assistance program remained at 20% of overall supply. Range should remain relatively unchanged for the foreseeable future.
    • Shares are down 1% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 3 Comments

    Sun Hydraulics EPS in-line, beats on revenue

    • Shares +2.4%.

    Palo Alto Networks beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Revenue of $542.4M (+28.3% Y/Y) beats by $17.42M.
    • Shares +4%.

  • CDEV

    Centennial Resource beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Centennial Resource (NASDAQ:CDEV): Q4 EPS of $0.12 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $166.1M (+402.7% Y/Y) beats by $14.82M.
    • Shares +1.5%.

    | 4:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • WPG

    Bounce underway for mall names

    • Looking anywhere for some value in a pricey market, investors have taken an interest in the highly-roughed-up shopping center names.
    • Over the past three sessions, Washington Prime (NYSE:WPG) is up 14.7%, CBL & Associates (NYSE:CBL) 7.3%, DDR (DDR) 8.5%, PREIT (NYSE:PEI) 8%, and Kite Realty (NYSE:KRG) 4.2%, to name five.
    • The advance comes alongside an easing in interest pressure, with the 10-year Treasury yield at 2.86% this afternoon, after challenging 3% last week.
    • Previously: Averages add another 1% (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 11 Comments
  • WGO

    RV names move off Airstream news

    • Winnebago (NYSE:WGO) is up 5.0% and LCI Industries (NYSE:LCII) is 2.7% higher after a hefty investment from rival Thor Industries in its Airstream business lifts sentiment across the RV sector.
    • The Airstream news also has Camping World (CWH +1.4%) heading for the hills.
    • Previously: Thor Industries rallies after tipping Airstream expansion (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 2 Comments
  • SMMT

    Summit's ezutromid reduced muscle inflammation in mid-stage DMD study; shares ahead 2%

    • Summit Therapeutics (SMMT +1.8%) announces that a further analysis of the results from a Phase 2 clinical trial, PhaseOutDMD, assessing DMD candidate ezutromid showed a statistically significant decrease in muscle inflammation from baseline at week 24 in tissue samples.
    • The company says the decrease, measured by magnetic resonance spectroscopy transverse relaxation time T2 (MRS-T2), underlines ezutromid's activity to stabilize muscle fiber membranes which reduces muscle fiber damage and inflammation.
    • Also observed was a statistically significant decrease from baseline in T2 relaxation time in the calf muscle, a key muscle used to monitor DMD progression. Increases in T2 relaxation time correlate with the advancement of disease and loss of functional ability.
    • Previously: Summit Therapeutics' ezutromid shows positive effect in mid-stage DMD study; shares up 5% premarket (Jan. 25)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar +5% as Deutsche Bank defends shares following Friday's loss

    • First Solar (FSLR +4.9%) recoups much of its post-earnings loss that occurred despite a smaller than expected Q4 loss and upside FY 2018 guidance.
    • Deutsche Bank analysts maintain a Buy rating with a $75 price target after Friday's nearly 7% shellacking, as they expect capacity expansion in the U.S. considering FSLR's 9 GW backlog and near-term potential to sell out through 2020.
    • The firm notes FSLR expects its S6 modules to offset S4 module discounts and generate a premium to c-Si panels, which it says could drive 2019 average selling prices above 2018 levels.
    • Deutsche Bank also says FSLR has the biggest backlog in U.S. business, which generates higher price points and better margins than international bookings.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • RCM

    Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 pm (2/26/18)

    • Losers: I -15%. MYSZ -15%. QBAK -12%. MAXR -8%. TST -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • TLRA

    Telaria down 22% on Q4 results

    • Telaria (TLRA -22.5%) reported Q4 revenue increase of 45% Y/Y to $15M, almost meeting consensus.
    • Operating loss margin recovered to -7.41%.
    • Reported adjusted EBITDA of $3M and adjusted EBITDA margin of 20%.
    • Guidance: 1Q18 Revenue of  $8.5-10M and adjusted EBITDA -$4.5 to -3.5M. FY18 Revenue $58-62M and adjusted EBITDA of $5-8M.
    • Telaria appointed Rick Song as Chief Revenue Office. His previous stint included building successful sales teams at Microsoft, iHeart and Zefr.
    • Previously: Telaria misses by $0.03, misses on revenue (Feb. 26 2018)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • EXK

    Endeavour Silver misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Endeavour Silver (NYSE:EXK): Q4 EPS of $0.02 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $41.6M (+45.2% Y/Y) beats by $1.57M.
    • Shares +1.9%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM

  • Averages add another 1%

    • A bit more than an hour before the bell, the S&P 500 and Nasdaq are higher by 1% and the Dow by 1.4%.
    • Among the largest S&P advancers is none other than Berkshire Hathaway, up 3.7% following Q4 results, the release of the annual letter, and The Oracle's appearance on CNBC this morning. Investors hoping for Buffett to reverse his longstanding distaste of paying a dividend were disappointed, but he did seem open to returning capital via buybacks should no tasty big acquisition opportunities arise.
    • The 10-year Treasury yield is flat at 2.86%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 10 Comments
  • LUCRF

    Lucara Diamond +18% on blockchain deal; names Thomas as new CEO

    • Lucara Diamond (OTCPK:LUCRF +18.2%) surges after agreeing to acquire blockchain company Clara Diamond Solutions for $29M, joining larger rival DeBeers in exploring blockchain technology.
    • Clara is operator of a digital platform selling rough diamonds as well as blockchain technology that seeks to track gems through the industry supply chain.
    • Separately, Lucara appoints co-founder and director Eira Thomas as its new CEO, replacing the retiring William Lamb.
    • Lucara currently operates a mine in Botswana famous for its big stones, including a 1,109-carat diamond in 2016.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:43 PM | 9 Comments
  • AWI

    More on Armstrong World's Q4 results

    • Armstrong World (AWI -4%) reported 9.1% Y/Y revenue growth to $214.3M meeting analyst estimates; Segment revenue: Architectural Specialties +49% Y/Y to $36.8M which was driven by higher volume, led by the Tectum acquisition and increased new construction activity, Mineral Fiber +3.4% Y/Y to $177.6M.
    • Q4 operating margin improved 361 bps to 24.13%. Mineral fiber segment’s operating margin declined 154 bps to 22.57% and architectural specialties improved 310 bps to 19.3%.
    • 2018 guidance: Net Sales +5-7% Y/Y and adjusted Free Cash Flow +20-30%.
    • “Our guidance for 2018 anticipates a slightly more favorable macro-economic climate, but is largely driven by factors within our control. We expect to deliver improved Average Unit Value in our sales, drive productivity savings greater than inflation, and drive cost savings from our restructuring actions in St. Helens and our corporate back office, especially in the second half of the year,” said CFO Brian MacNeal.
    • Previously: Armstrong World misses by $0.17, misses on revenue (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CVRR

    CVR Refining eyes $49M saving on biofuels as Trump weighs policy change

    • CVR Energy (CVRR -2.5%) estimates spending $200M this year, nearly $50M less than in 2017, to comply with the U.S. biofuel mandate, according to a new 10-K filing.
    • While CVR has not provided a direct reason for the savings, CEO David Lamp expressed optimism during last Thursday's earnings conference call that the Trump administration eventually would change the mandate.
    • Trump reportedly is discussing potential policy changes today with EPA chief Pruitt, Agriculture Secretary Perdue and Vice Pres. Mike Pence and tomorrow will present options to four key U.S. senators involved in the issue.
    • CVR’s filing also reiterates that the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Southern District of New York contacted the company last September to ask for information related to director Carl Icahn’s activities in his role as advisor to Trump.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM | 7 Comments
  • AABA

    JPMorgan: Altaba call could delve into Yahoo Japan monetization

    • Altaba (AABA -0.4%) is set to deliver a conference call tomorrow that may give some clarity on a potential timeline for monetizing its Yahoo Japan (YAHOY +1.9%) stake, JPMorgan says.
    • That's more likely now with successful tax reform legislation, analyst Doug Anmuth suggests. There are complex tax-efficient ways to monetize Yahoo Japan, he says, but the most likely outcome is a fully taxed share sale.
    • AABA stock is trading around a 26% discount to its pretax NAV, JPMorgan says.
    • UBS analyst Eric Sheridan does expect the call will cover tax effects but won't touch Yahoo Japan monetization, Bloomberg's Stephen Sweeney notes.
    • The call is set for 8:30 a.m. ET tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 126 Comments
  • BOJA

    Bojangles still trending higher

    • Something is going on with Bojangles (BOJA +6.1%). Shares have now moved over their 50-day and 100-day moving averages per Bloomberg in a two-week rally tied to M&A speculation.
    • The strong move comes ahead of Bojangles earnings report scheduled for March 6.
    • Bojangles still trades on the low end of its 52-week range of $11.35 to $22.35.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • TAHO

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm (2/26/2018)

    • Gainers: TAHO +19%. IKNX +14%. RKDA +9%. ZN +8%. ECR +8%.
    • Losers: SQM -9%. SEMG -9%. ALB -8%. ASIX -6%. ICD -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM | 21 Comments
  • ZSAN

    Zosano up big but news scarce; shares ahead 95%

    • Thinly traded nano cap Zosano Pharma (ZSAN +95.3%) is up a healthy 21x surge in volume. No particular news accounts for the action.
    • A couple of weeks ago, it filed an updated prospectus for a public offering of 12.5M shares of common stock.
    • At the end of Q3 2017, it had $19.8M in quick assets. Operations consumed $21.0M through the first three quarters of last year.
    • Previously: Zosano's M207 shows treatment effect in late-stage migraine study; shares ahead 19% (Sept. 13, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • ADVM

    Adverum progressing study of ADVM-043 in A1AT deficiency; investors unmoved, shares down 4%

    • The independent Data Monitoring Committee has recommended proceeding to the second cohort in a Phase 1/2 clinical trial, ADVANCE, evaluating Adverum Biotechnologies' (ADVM -3.6%) lead candidate ADVM-043 for the treatment of alpha-1 antitrypsin (A1AT) deficiency, a rare inherited disorder associated with increased risk of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, liver disease and skin problems. Preliminary results should be available in H2.
    • The DMC's go-ahead was based on safety data generated in the first cohort (n=2) which received a lose dose of the gene therapy.
    • ADVM-043 is designed to induce stable long-term A1AT protein from a single administration.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 7 Comments
  • NCMI

    National CineMedia +6.2% on heavy volume

    • Heavy volume that arrived around 10:45 has lifted shares of theatrical advertising firm National CineMedia (NCMI +6.2%), which has hit its highest point since last May.
    • More than 1M shares have changed hands vs. a typical daily average of less than 500K.
    • There's no single catalyst for the move, though the company this week rolled out a new augmented reality app (Noovie ARcade) to go along with its revamped film preshow.
    • The company's also likely riding some of the record success of Marvel's Black Panther; NCMI partnered with Marvel parent Disney in the fall on a deal that sends exclusive behind-the-scenes footage to preshows for key Disney releases including Coco, Solo, Avengers: Infinity War and Black Panther.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 6 Comments
  • QCOM

    FT: Qualcomm wants over $90/share from Broadcom

    • Qualcomm (NASDAQ:QCOM) would agree to Broadcom’s (NASDAQ:AVGO) acquisition offer if the price were raised to $160B (including $25B in debt), which equals out to above $90/share, according to FT sources. 
    • Broadcom is currently offering $79 per share ($142B), so Qualcomm wants at least 15% more. 
    • Sources say Broadcom has made enough progress in addressing potential antitrust issues that the talks have shifted to price negotiations. 
    • Broadcom calls Qualcomm’s price talks “engagement theatre” and says it doesn’t believe the letter released earlier today was “designed to lead to a prompt agreement.” 
    • Qualcomm shares are up 4.3%. 
    • Broadcom shares are down 0.5%.  
    • Previously: Qualcomm and Broadcom met again, still stuck on price (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM | 177 Comments
  • HMNY

    Helios and Matheson higher amid Black Panther phenomenon

    • Helios and Matheson Analytics (NASDAQ:HMNY) is up 3.65% to $5.11 on what's been a strong day for movie theater stocks.
    • There's still a lot to unpack with the MoviePass business model as the company is seemingly on the financial hook after attendance rises like over the last two weekends. On the flip side, you have Canaccord Genuity issuing a price target of $15 and explaining in great detail how MoviePass' explosive growth will lead to huge leverage opportunities down the road (think Priceline.com).
    • There's also quite of trading on HMNY based off the stock's volatility, and not its business model or fundamentals.
    • Previously: Black Panther provides another lift to theater sector (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM | 50 Comments
  • AAPL

    Bloomberg: Apple releasing three iPhones this fall

    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) will release three new iPhones this fall, according to Bloomberg sources.
    • The lineup will include the largest iPhone ever (close to a 6.5-inch screen), a lower cost version of the iPhone X, and a budget-friendly option that doesn’t skimp on the features.  
    • The large, phablet iPhone could have a screen resolution of 1242 x 2688 and will include an OLED panel and Face ID like the X. 
    • The phablet and the smaller, updated iPhone X version will both have next-gen A12 processors and stainless steel edges. 
    • Apple is considering a dual-SIM card option for the larger model, which could sell well in Europe and Asia where customers travel between countries more frequently. 
    • The third, lower cost version will have an edge-to-edge screen and Face ID like the X but a cheaper LCD screen, aluminum edges, and a glass back.
    • Apple sold 77.3M iPhones in Q4 of CY17 compared to the 80.2M expected by analysts.  
    • Apple shares are up 1.9%.  
    • Previously: Apple confirms using Google Cloud; Cook will co-chair China business forum (Feb. 26)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM | 43 Comments
  • NFLX

    The Netflix $300 watch is on

    • Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) is up 2.39% on the day and pushed to as high as $295.59 earlier in the day as the watch for $300 gets a little more serious.
    • Just short of 7M shares of Netflix have traded today vs. the daily average of 8.59M shares.
    • While there's no question that the multi-year run for Netflix has been dizzying, SA contributor Ziyaad Manie laid out the case last week as to why the rally makes sense based off of long-term subscriber growth estimates and higher pricing

    GE's latest troubles knock shares back further; analysts cite 'litany of liabilities'

    • General Electric (GE -1.8%) tumbles as much as 3.7% to a new 52-week low after revealing plans to restate earnings for 2016 and 2017 to reflect a new accounting standard, disclosing an investigation into subprime mortgage loans made before the financial crisis, and making changes to its board.
    • J.P. Morgan analyst Stephen Tusa maintains his Underweight rating on GE and Deutsche Bank's John Inch keeps his Sell rating and $13 price target, saying the company is vulnerable to contingent liability risks.
    • Vertical Research's Jeff Sprague reiterates a Hold rating, saying GE faces a "litany of liabilities," and estimating GE Industrial's leverage is at 3.2x his 2018 EBITDA estimate and that GE Capital may not be able to fully fund its legacy liabilities without support from GE.
    • CEO John Flannery sends a letter to shareholder acknowledging "a very tough year" in 2017 while defending the company, saying “How [GE] is being portrayed in certain quarters is overwrought and, in most cases, does not reflect the reality of GE that our customers and employees are seeing around the world.   • MACK

    Mid-stage study underway on Merrimack's seribantumab in breast cancer; shares up 1%

    • The first patient has been dosed in a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating Merrimack Pharmaceuticals' (MACK +1.4%) MM-121 (seribantumab) in patients with heregulin-positive, hormone receptor-positive, HER2-negative postmenopausal metastatic breast cancer.
    • The randomized study will assess the combination of seribantumab and fulvestrant (AstraZeneca's FASLODEX) compared to fulvestrant + placebo. The primary endpoint is progression-free survival (PFS) at month 20. The estimated primary completion date is April 2019.
    • Heregulin is a secreted growth factor that is associated with cell proliferation, invasion, survival and differentiation in certain malignancies.
    • Seribantumab is a fully human monoclonal antibody that binds to a receptor on tumor cells called ErbB3, which is activated by heregulin. ErbB3 signaling is thought to play a key role in tumor growth and resistance to cytotoxic and anti-endocrine therapies. Seribantumab blocks ErbB3 signaling which enhances the anti-tumor effect of the combination therapy.
    • Previously: Merrimack's MM-121 an Orphan Drug in U.S. for heregulin-positive non-small cell lung cancer; shares ahead 5% premarket (Oct. 30, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM | 1 Comment

  • DRRX

    Mid-stage study underway assessing DURECT's DUR-928 in PSC; shares up 2%

    • Dosing is underway in a Phase 2a clinical trial evaluating DURECT's (DRRX +1.8%) lead candidate DUR-928 in patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC), a chronic liver disorder characterized by progressive inflammation and fibrosis (scarring) in the bile ducts.
    • The co-primary endpoints of the open-label study are safety and the percent change from baseline in serum alkaline phosphatase, an enzyme that serves as a biomarker for liver or bone disease.
    • According to ClinicalTrials.gov, the estimated completion date is January 2019.
    • DUR-928 is a small molecule drug that modulates the activity of various nuclear receptors involved in liver homeostasis (stable function). It is under development for the potential treatment of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).

  • ECYT

    Endocyte readies late-stage study of Lu-PSMA-617 in prostate cancer; shares up 7%

    • Endocyte (ECYT +6.9%) launches a Phase 3 clinical trial, VISION, assessing Lu-PSMA-617 in patients with progressive prostate-specific membrane antigen (PSMA)-positive metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) who have received at least one novel androgen axis drug (NAAD) and at least one taxane regimen. Enrollment will commence next quarter.
    • The primary endpoint of the open-label, 750-subject study is overall survival (OS) in patients receiving Lu-PSMA-617 plus best supportive care alone or in combination with a NAAD compared to best supportive care alone or in combination a NAAD. Patients in the treatment group will receive Lu-PSMA-617 intravenously every six weeks up to six cycles.
    • Interim data from 50 patients in an Australia-based study will be presented at ASCO in June.
    • Lu-PSMA-617, licensed from ABX GmbH, selectively delivers short-range beta-emitting radioactive isotope lutetium to tumor cells that express prostate-specific membrane antigen (PSMA).

    • Apple’s recent concessions to the Chinese government have earned criticism. The company blocked virtual private network apps from the App Store in the region and will this week move iCloud customer data to mainland servers.
